communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: UAB Construction Projects
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Construction Project(s):  Frances and Miller Gorrie Hall, Altec Styslinger Genomic Medicine and Data Sciences Building, McCallum Building Renovation, 14th Street Parking Deck, Cooper Green Mercy Health Building, Science and Engineering Complex, Central Utilities Expansion to Cultural District, Spain Rehabilitation Center
Records:  Executed Contract with Architect of Record, Executed Contract with General Contractor, Most Recent Pricing Proposal from General Contractor, Most Recent Construction Schedule from General Contractor, Most Recent Pay Application/Invoice from Architect of Record, Most Recent Pay Application/Invoice from General Contractor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Mitchell Garner.

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennesee DOT Shelby County Project
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Relating to the SR-14/US-61 Bridges project over ICRR and Nonconnah Creek in Shelby County, Tennessee:

All RFP Responses from Contractors for the project.
All RFP Responses for Designers for the project.
The Executed Preconstruction Phase Contract for the Contractor.
The Executed Design Phase Contract for the Design Team.
The Contractor Selection Scoring Sheet and any supporting backup documentation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Mitchell Garner.
